moves.5... Bxc3 6. Bxc3 Nc6 7. e3 b6 8. Bd3 Ba: I would have probably moved to b7.
moves.11. Rb1 Na5 12. Bxa5: Yes, yes, it was a bishop for a knight, but it does give him isolated, doubled pawns and it wasn't a great bishop anyway.
moves.14... Rc8 15. a4 g6: ? I wouldn't have done this, it's too weakening.
moves.18. Bxg6: I thought about the knight, but decided on taking with the bishop. If he takes my bishop, then Qxg6+ Kh8 and black is obviously doomed. If he takes my knight then I can take his pawn or knight.
moves.20... Kxh7 21. Nxf8+ Kg8 22. Rh3: Probably should have rescued my knight.
moves.22... Qxf8 23. Qg6: His king is immobilized, but it looks like he has it under control.
moves.23... dxc4: ?? Allows my rook an open file, now completely losing but pretty bad.
moves.24. bxc4 Bxc4: ???? Got greedy, he should have left his bishop where it was then I couldn't move my rook to b7.
moves.25. Rb7: I pounce on the opportunity. Black has no way to stop mate that I can see.
moves.25... Qe8 26. Qxg7#: Good game black! Please comment and rate.
